intro: Caphexandra, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants typically have palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red.
